H0.text: Arteries are the part of the circulatory system responsible for exchanging nutrients and wastes, thereby carrying cellular nutrients to the body.

H1.text: Capillaries are the part of the circulatory system responsible for exchanging nutrients and wastes, carrying cellular nutrients to the body.

H2.text: The heart is the part of the circulatory system responsible for exchanging nutrients and wastes to carry cellular nutrients to the body.

H3.text: Veins are the part of the circulatory system responsible for exchanging nutrients and wastes to carry cellular nutrients to the body.

A4.text: Nutrients travel through tiny blood vessels of the microcirculation to reach organs.
